page.title: 10St. Peter's School Uniform
page.content:
Our school uniform consists of a navy blue jumper or cardigan, a white or grey shirt or blouse worn with black or grey trousers, or navy skirt or tunic. The distinctive tie is navy blue with diagonal stripes of white, red and yellow. The school badge has a key, crossed palm leaves and a fish on it, denoting the key of St. Peter, the first Pope, with his trade. The crossed palms are the symbol of Christians. St. Peter's School is a school for Roman Catholic children who live in the northern part of Plymouth.
Matthew Davey
